info.name: Quoting_v4_Collection_4.0.1
info.description:
StartFragment

The Lumen Quote v4 API Collection runs through different scenarios for common product configurations. Collections are not intended to cover every possible product configuration, but to provide a baseline for developers who can then customize to their unique quoting use case. For additional support using Quoting v4 APIs please refer to [https://developer.lumen.com/apis](https://desktop.postman.com/?desktopVersion=10.5.2&userId=11059854&teamId=3196298)

Samples in this collection are based on a demo account. Responses do not represent actual pricing.

### Authorization

Before you start using these collections:

- Register a user at developer.lumen.com
- Under "My Apps" create a Sandbox App and add the API Products you want to use.
- Under "My Apps" create a Production App and add API Products you want to use.
- Once your credentials are approved they will move from pending to approved.
    

### Setup Collection Variables

Go to the Variables tab at the top of the collection and replace the following values with your own:

- key_secret: Find this in My Apps at developer.lumen.com
- secret_sandbox: Find this in My Apps at developer.lumen.com
- key_production: Find this in My Apps at developer.lumen.com
- secret_sandbox: Find this in My Apps at developer.lumen.com
- x-customer-number: Customer number (Bus Org) you were approved to use with onboarding
- customerNumber: same customer number (Bus Org) you were approved to use with onboarding
- be sure to click SAVE when you are done
    

Variables are used throughout the collection to help update your specific ids. Authorization is set at the collection level and inherited by all child folders.

EndFragment

item.name: Getting Started

request.description:
To set authorization for the collection go to Quoting_v4_Collection authorization tab and enter Lumen Consumer Key as Username and Consumer Secret at Password.

Use this post call to oauth/token to connect to authorization server directly and retrieve the bearer token.

query.description: The city name for the address
The name of the state if such information exist for the address

request.description: This resource allows a user to pass address information in an attempt to validate that an address exists and is supported by Lumen.

response.name: Success

query.description: The city name for the address
The name of the state if such information exist for the address

item.name: List of products enabled for the customer.

query.description: (Required) Customer Number for customer. Also known as BusOrg number

request.description: Lists products, and their details, that a customer number is allowed to quote. This resource allows filtering of the products available by allowing the user to pass optional query parameters for location.

response.name: Success

query.description: (Required) Customer Number for customer. Also known as BusOrg number

item.name: Combinations of attribute values as a tuple set.

query.description: (Required) Product code as received from the previous call
(Required) Customer Number for customer. Also known as BusOrg number

request.description: Provides a list of product attributes and valid combinations of attribute values as a tuple. All data is returned for the product and customer number passed in the input request. Response includes what the customer number is allowed to quote. Users can pass an optional query parameter for location.

response.name: Success

query.description: (Required) Product code as received from the previous call
(Required) Customer Number for customer. Also known as BusOrg number

request.description:
Provides a list of product attributes and valid combinations of attribute values as a tuple. All data is returned for the product and customer number passed in the input request. Response includes what the customer number is allowed to quote. Users can pass an optional query parameter for location.

Truple Sets:

- Bandwidth, Access Sub Bandwidth, Access Quantity, Term
- Billing Method
- CPE Provider
    

Getting Started shows each Config Type for DIA product.

response.name: Success - Config Type CPE
Success - Config Type BE
Success - Config Type MEA
Success - Config Type CDR
Error - Incorrect Customer ID in Body
Error - Change Product Code in Body to PC564
Error - Changed Configtype in Body

request.description: This resource is used for pricing a product configuration these are considered pre-quotes or temporary quotes. These quotes expire after a short time, but can be saved so to extend the expiration on them in the save quote call.

response.name: Success
Error - Invalid Customer Number
Error - Wrong input for terms
Error - Invalid kit name

item.name: To persist the price received from the pricing call.

request.description: Save a temporary quote to be a full quote and extend the expiration period of the full quote."

response.name: PCAT number - Error: Already Saved
Error- using -1 instead of -3 in PCAT number - Error: Invalid Data Parameter

item.name: Fetch quotes that have been saved

query.description: (Required) Product code as received from the previous call
(Required) Customer Number for customer. Also known as BusOrg number

request.description: Provides a list of product attributes and valid combinations of attribute values as a tuple. All data is returned for the product and customer number passed in the input request. Response includes what the customer number is allowed to quote. Users can pass an optional query parameter for location.

response.name: Success

query.description: (Required) Product code as received from the previous call
(Required) Customer Number for customer. Also known as BusOrg number

item.description:
StartFragment

### **Before You Start**

Make sure you have approved credentials and set up Collection Variables pages as described in the Collection intro.

More information on using Quote calls can be found at:

[https://developer.lumen.com/apis/quoting#getting-started](https://desktop.postman.com/?desktopVersion=10.5.2&userId=11059854&teamId=3196298)

### **Making Your First Calls**

The Getting Started section includes quoting calls in a logical order of operations. There is an example request for each endpoint so you can see how calls broadly work together. You may not need to make every call each time you want to get a price quote.

**POST /OAuth/token:**

This collection is already set up to inherit from the parent However we have also included an example call if you choose to setup an authorization call independently. Remember once you request a token older tokens become invalid.

_**Prices in this collection are for illustrative purposes only and do not represent real pricing expectations.**_

**Other Resources**

[https://learning.postman.com/docs/getting-started/introduction/](https://desktop.postman.com/?desktopVersion=10.5.2&userId=11059854&teamId=3196298)

More information on setting up Lumen authorization go to[https://developer.lumen.com/apis/quoting#authentication](https://desktop.postman.com/?desktopVersion=10.5.2&userId=11059854&teamId=3196298)

  

AuthorizationOAuth 2.0

This folder is using an authorization helper from collection Quoting_v4_Collection_4.0.1

EndFragment

request.description:
Provides a list of product attributes and valid combinations of attribute values as a tuple. All data is returned for the product and customer number passed in the input request. Response includes what the customer number is allowed to quote. Users can pass an optional query parameter for location.

Truple Sets:

- Bandwidth, Access Sub Bandwidth, Access Quantity, Term
- Billing Method
- CPE Provider
    

Use a specific Config Type in the request body to get the corresponding Truple information

- BE: Address
- CDR: Bandwidth, Access Sub Bandwidth, Billing Method, Access Quantity
- CPE: Bandwidth, Access Sub Bandwidth, Billing Method, Access Quantity, CPE Provider, CDR
- MEA: Bandwidth, Billing Method, Access Quantity, CDR

response.name: Success - Config Type CDR
Success - Config Type BE
Success Config Type - CPE
Success - Config Type MEA

request.description: This resource is used for pricing a product configuration these are considered pre-quotes or temporary quotes. These quotes expire after a short time, but can be saved so to extend the expiration on them in the save quote call.

response.name: Success On-net
Success Off-net

item.description:
### E-Line Price Request Details

Quotes for bandwidths over 3000 Mbps at off-net locations are not supported through the API.

StartFragment

- productCode \[PC159\]
- Network Status/zNetwork Status \[On Net, Off Net\]
- EVC Type \[EPL, EVPL\]
- Bandwidth \[2 Mbps, 4 Mbps, 6 Mbps, 8 Mbps, 10 Mbps, 15 Mbps, 20 Mbps, 25 Mbps, 30 Mbps, 35 Mbps, 40 Mbps, 45 Mbps, 50 Mbps, 55 Mbps, 60 Mbps, 65 Mbps, 70 Mbps, 75 Mbps, 80 Mbps, 85 Mbps, 90 Mbps, 95 Mbps, 100 Mbps, 150 Mbps, 200 Mbps, 250 Mbps, 300 Mbps, 350 Mbps, 400 Mbps, 450 Mbps, 500 Mbps, 550 Mbps, 600 Mbps, 650 Mbps, 700 Mbps, 750 Mbps, 800 Mbps, 850 Mbps, 900 Mbps, 950 Mbps, 1000 Mbps, 2000 Mbps, 3000 Mbps, 4000 Mbps, 5000 Mbps, 6000 Mbps, 7000 Mbps, 8000 Mbps, 9000 Mbps, 10000 Mbps, 15000 Mbps, 20000 Mbps, 25000 Mbps, 30000 Mbps\]
- Port Bandwidth \[ListMbps1, ListMbps2, ListMbps3\]
- Class \[Enhanced, Dedicated, Basic\]
- Dynamic Capacity \[No, Yes\]
- ALoc UNI Type/zLoc UNI Type \[Transparent, Multiplex\]
- aInside/zInside Wiring \[No, Yes\]
- Access Type \[Point to Point, Point to Existing, Multiplexed Uni\]

- Protection \[Unprotected\]
